Portfolio

About

My name is Thomas Hansen, I have graduated from the University of Waterloo, with a degree in Mathematics with a minor in Psychology in April 2019. During my time here I was a part of their amazing Co-op program to where I worked at the international bank NN Group, worked at Nissan's Canadian HQ and worked at ATS as a Co-op student and after worked there while completing my studies.

After university, I moved to Pittsburgh and worked for Uber ATG and Aurora Innovation. In my spare time I enjoy playing sports and play professional Ultimate Frisbee for the Pittsburgh Thunderbirds. Growing up, I played hockey, soccer, and frisbee all competitively while also enjoying to rock climb, curl, and play basketball. Currently working on a new web game as well!

Location

Pittsburgh, PA

Agriculture Canada

I worked at the Government of Canada for my first co-op. Here I worked for Agriculture Canada where I worked with Powershell and Microsoft Sharepoint mainly. With Powershell, I used it to create scripts and reports that helped the team. Also during this co-op term, I also created several Microsoft Sharepoint sites.

CGI

In my second co-op position, I worked at CGI a global financial company. I was tasked at testing their financial programs that they use at the banks. I worked on and tested the new and improved Financial Wealth platforms that they were rolling out.

NN Group

This co-op position was an 8 month job in the Netherlands. NN Group is Netherlands biggest bank, and there I worked in their Reinsurance department. I helped work on, create and test their in-house financial hedging tool.

Nissan Canada Financial Services

In my 4th co-op position, I worked at Nissan's Financial Headquarters of Canada. I was brought in to help fix their workbooks and create new reports using mainly VBA.

ATS Automation

My last co-op position and current job is at ATS Automation. They are a global engineering firm and I work in their finance department to fix their workbooks and create new reports using VBA and MQuery.

Uber Advanced Technologies Group

I started working at Uber as a Triage Operations Analyst where I would problem solve and assess how the Autonomous Vehicle's performance. In February, I started working in a Software Engineer role where I worked on building a Reporting Tool for the Triage team. After that was complete, I transitioned to improving our Workflow Manager tool. I implemented bulk edit, nesting of tables and overall UI and UX improvements

Aurora Innovation

At Aurora, I continued to hone my software engineering skills. Built a centralized tag management application and service to allow a versioning system for the tags and labels we applied. Expanded our workflow management tool to eventually have 30 different workflows on boarded. Also went on to mentor 2 summer interns over the course of my 3 years here
